channel.title: [PI] [REQ] i need help with a command!
channel.description: I'm not sure if I can do this, but I'm requesting a ::combat command that changes your combat to whatever level you want. I don't want it changing your stats, I just want it to change the combat level.

item.title: [PI] [REQ] i need help with a command!
item.dc:creator: @Roar337 Roar337
item.description:
@Roar337 wrote:

[quote=“Tix, post:50, topic:420450”][quote author=Wet Dreamss link=topic=522998.msg3805221#msg3805221 date=1320411955]

Lol.

  1. Mopar is not a spoon feeding community
  2. I’m almost positive this is not possible without having to change stats
    edit: not to be a dick

lol anything is possible just difficult… and combat level is probs calculated using other stats if not then xp of other stats anyways you would have to change that fact to make this command…

what do u mean?
[/quote]He’s saying that Skills (combat) are an important part to the combat level system, so with a command ::combat it would have to change skills, and if it didn’t it would reset after a relog.

hmm… okay.[/quote]

close but nahh i meant it uses skills and if you dont want it to use skills you have to change it… cmon im stating the obvious >.<

Read full topic

Because you typed the command wrong.

  • This only works while you’re logged in, it will reset after you’ve logged out.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] [REQ] i need help with a command!

item.title: [PI] [REQ] i need help with a command!
item.dc:creator: @Tix Tix
item.description:
@Tix wrote:

i fixed the errors but it only said: Invaild String Length.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("combat")) { try { final String[] arg = playerCommand.split(" "); if (arg.length == 1) { c.combatLevel = Integer.parseInt(arg[1]); c.sendMessage("Your combat level is now: " + Integer.parseInt(arg[1])); } else { c.sendMessage("Invaild String Length."); return; } } catch (NumberFormatException exception) { exception.printStackTrace(); } }

Read full topic

item.source: [PI] [REQ] i need help with a command!

item.title: [PI] [REQ] i need help with a command!
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“Tix, post:29, topic:420450”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=522998.msg3804697#msg3804697 date=1320356821]
Okay, want more?

Here is an example, you can try it if you want, but it will not work.

		if (command.equals("combat")) {
			try {
			    final String[] arg = playerCommand.split(" ");
				if (arg.length == 1) {
				    Client.getCombat.playerCombatLevel = Integer.parseInt(arg[1]);
				    ((Client) Client.getActionAssistant).sendMessage("Your combat level is now: " + Integer.parseInt(arg[1]));
				} else {
				    ((Client) Client.getActionAssistant).sendMessage("Invaild String Length.");
				    return;
				}
			} catch (NumberFormatException exception) {
			    exception.printStackTrace();
			}
		}

[/quote]

[code]compiling…

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:587: error: cannot find symbol
if (command.equals(“combat”)) {
^
symbol: variable command
location: class Commands
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:591: error: cannot find symbol
Client.getCombat.playerCombatLevel = Integer
.parseInt(arg[1]);
^
symbol: variable getCombat
location: class Client
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:592: error: cannot find symbol
((Client) Client.getActionAssistant).sendMes
sage("Your combat level is now: " + Integer.parseInt(arg[1]));
^
symbol: variable getActionAssistant
location: class Client
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:594: error: cannot find symbol
((Client) Client.getActionAssistant).sendMes
sage(“Invaild String Length.”);
^
symbol: variable getActionAssistant
location: class Client
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
4 errors
Tryck ned valfri tangent för att fortsätta…[/code][/quote]
read the errors buddy…
edit: if you knew anything about commands, you would instantly see the errors.

Read full topic
